channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Sign damaged on corner of Naunton Lane and Naunton Way, 22nd January
item.description:
The traffic priority sign on the corner of Naunton Lane and Naunton Way has been knocked by passing traffic several times. It is now leaning, and one of the signs has slipped down the pole and now presents an obstruction and tripping hazard for pedestrians.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 2 Naunton Way, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Very uneven pavement, 21st January
item.description:
Itâ€™s been like this for months and is a real trip hazard. I struggle to get my buggy over it and my son often trips on it or knocks him off his scooter.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 86 Nettleton Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: MAJOR flooding on Kingsditch roundabout, 21st January
item.description:
Huge lake on Kingsditch roundabout (west side). Been flooding here after any decent spell of rain for months - there are FLOOD signs on the roundabout (been there for months, too). Obviously somebody in authority knows there is an issue here as the warning signs have been there for ages - is anything actually being done to fix the issue?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Tewkesbury Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: There is an excessive amount of rubbish on both sides of the road between The Reddings and Bamfurlong Lane in the drainage ditches, 20th January

item.title: 30cm pothole (10+ cm deep) on Kidnappers Lane, 19th January
item.description:
Pothole on left hand side of road, just before gate into Lotts Meadow, when travelling towards Church Road. Pothole has got significant larger and deeper in recent rains causing damage to vehicles and safety risk to cyclists give the narrowness of Kidnappers Lane.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Field Cottage Kidnappers Lane, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Extremely deteriorated pavement along Limber Hill, 19th January
item.description:
The pavement either side of Limber Hill road near Prestbury is damaged and fragmented - the asphalt is cracking and crumbling substantially, making it very dangerous to walk along. It also paces uphill, making it challenging and uncomfortable for residents to use especially if they are elderly or infirm. It also gets very icy and slippery in winter as it's in very poor condition overall, and not safe to use. Please could you take a look into it? Many thanks, Tabi

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 1 Limber Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 15 meter long pothole along Roman Hackle Avenue, 19th January
item.description:
There's quite a dangerous and lengthy pothole running along the centre of Roman Hackle Avenue near Prestbury - it's quite deep at one end but has caused concern to local residents. Please could you take a look? Thanks, Tabi

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 1 Limber Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Kerb clearance, 19th January
item.description:
The kerbs the whole length of Montpellier Spa Road are completely blocked with accumulated mud , sludge and leaves and badly need clearing , combination of manpower and sweeper required . Sir rob Wright Chairman Friends of Montpellier Gardens and residents association

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 34a Montpellier Spa Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: New light - doesn't work, 19th January
item.description:
New street light installed on pavement at junction of Queens Road and Gloucester Road (roundabout) - installed several weeks ago (mid-December), but to date does not work. On wide pavement, adjacent to stone boundary wall to railway station, by station sign. Been there several weeks now, so about time it actually worked.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Queen's Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
